chargeHist.descr: Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse or Child Abuse Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Floyd Wayne Lee Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery to Injunction Petitioner [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1m)(a).
  • Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse or Child Abuse Injunction, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(f).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment recommended.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Floyd Wayne Lee Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Floyd Wayne Lee Sr.  Attorney Claire E Zyber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 4 and 7:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

AS TO COUNTS 3, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, and 12: per plea negotiations and on the State's motion, Court ordered dismissed and read in.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS concurrent to Counts 2, 4 and 7 and consecutive to 21CF1743 and 22CM325.
 INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  3 YEARS. Credit for 215 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS concurrent to Counts 1, 4 and 7 and consecutive to 21CF1743 and 22CM325.
 INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 4: 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS concurrent to Counts 1, 2 and 7 and consecutive to 21CF1743 and 22CM325.
 INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 7:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS concurrent to Counts 1, 2 and 4 and consecutive to 21CF1743 and 22CM325.
 INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge out of prison wages with the balance to be paid during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges out of prison wages with the balance to be paid during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent;
-no contact with C.L.;
-mental health assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the Department of Corrections;
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment recommended;
-maintain full time work and/or school;
-pay restitution in the amount of $2,501.19 to C.L. to be paid first out of prison wages with any balance due to be paid during extended supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.

Defendant is informed he may not possess any firearms or body armor.
Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copies given to defendant. -- gmb

02:18 PM Defendant Floyd Wayne Lee in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Floyd Wayne Lee in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Floyd Wayne Lee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3, 5, 6, 9, 10 and 11.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
